Hands down the best game for Streamers and people who want to make more friends. The community  is filled with amazing people and the game is so much fun. Weather you are the a solo who wants to just have fun being a killer and testing his skills against a 4 man squad, or you go in as a survivor. Making friends and even just having a good time with your friends is always on the agenda for Dead by Daylight. Sure there might be a bad apple every now and then, but just click next and go on with the next game. ^-^
Surprisingly, the game is still very good and quite fun with friends. I can recommend it for sure!

Behavior Interactive... get yourselves together. This was one of the most entertaining games when it first came out and I loved it to death, pardon the pun. However since then, you've done nothing but make the game harder and harder to enjoy on a casual level. You stopped caring about the matchmaking system and made it impossible for people like me, who just hop on every few months to get a game that isn't full of the people who play weekly or daily. You ruined the balance by only letting the highest level people enjoy your game. I can't even play private matches because the changes the game has gone through have pushed all of my friends away from it. I want to like this game, I want to recommend it, but I physically can't.

After almost two years with the game and a couple hundred hours of play, I find it hard to truly recommend this game. DBD is a game I desperately want to like, but at its core, it's a busted game with terrible matchmaking. Toxic/unfair gameplay styles are seen as "legitimate" by the developers and as a result about a third of all games end up being massively un-fun or poorly matched. There are many ways these issues could be fixed, but it seems the devs are too afraid to adjust the game's current meta.

I really do hope the devs re-consider certain play styles to create a game that's fun for survivors and killers of all skill levels and play styles. But in the meantime, DBD serves as a perfect anger simulator.

Also there's only one game mode after six years. A little variety would be beneficial.
